reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at, in fact am writing from, Villa Laetitia and have to say we are extremely disappointed. The only person on staff we've met is Miguel, who is very very nice and helpful, but it's as if whoever owns this place woken up one day and said, "I think i'll run a hotel today."
reviews.title: Nice try but not ready for guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is under construction, which we were told in an email upon booking, but it said it "might" affect the "entrance" but would not affect our rooms. Well, the entrance is indeed trashed, but the grounds are also affected (the garden is not set up and chairs are stacked in corners). The room is big enough for us (we were told we HAD to book the suite for 3), but the floor is covered in construction dust. My feet are black if I walk barefoot. Not affected? I also can smell the dust and we can feel it when we breath in. IT's everywhere, not just contained to the entrance, which is 30 meters away. I said something to Miguel, again he is so nice, but he became defensive and said, "We told you there was construction." Well, that's true so I guess we are wrong to complain.
reviews.title: Nice location, somewhat disappointing accomodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower, as someone indicated below, is ridiculous. So small you can't bend over, or escape the water to shampoo your hair. No shelf in the sower means you have to step out to get shampoo and soap, and when you do, the water gets everywhere because the shower is literally, no exaggeration, 2 x 2 feet.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were shown the breakfast room when we arrived and assuming we could go there in the morning (breakfast time), we showed up at 9 to a darkened room, only to be told we had to let them know we wanted breakfast. Would have been nice to know that upon arrival.
reviews.title: Non Funtional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet service is slow slow slow. Took me 5 minutes to open this page. My husband can't even log onto the network and had to go ask if he would use their hard wire to download a contract he needs to sign. We are three people in our room, but only received 2 towels. All and all, it's not a place to enjoy a relaxing holiday. For the prince (290 euros a night) we could have found a place closer to the center, with staff who have run a hotel before.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The taxi dropped us off at the hotel at about 6 pm, and I immediately worried that I had screwed up in my choice. We couldn't see the hotel. We could see only a big gate that we couldn't see through. After a couple of minutes, we figured out to push a buzzer, and the gates swung inward. Still, I didn't feel much better because we then had to drag our luggage through a driveway filled with pebbles.
reviews.title: charming place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The payoff came a minute later when we came upon the hotel in the back. The friendly clerk at the counter directed us to our room. It was cozy but nicely designed. We learned that each of the rooms had been designed differently.
reviews.title: Convenience away from the Hustle & Bustle

likes.liked: — relaxing place to come home to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villa Laetitia did not look like your normal hotel. It is hidden behind an old-fashioned villa. But the uniqueness provides much of the charm.
reviews.title: Roman holiday

likes.liked: — the hotel staff were very helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the location. The hotel is located on an street that winds alongside the Tiber River. You can't actually see the river because of shrubbery where the hotel is situated. But you can walk in either direction, get clear of the shrubbery and cross the river. The hotel is also near a neat cafe where we ate breakfast and a restaurant where we ate tasty pasta. The hotel was not close to any of the main tourist spots. But that was ok since it gave us the chance to explore on foot.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, a peaceful retreat in a bustling city
Amazing
reviews.text: We stayed at Villa Laetitia in late September 2008. We found it a little difficult to find at first as, because it is a private villa, there are no big signs out the front and is easy to miss. Once located, a little trouble getting buzzed in which was abit off putting seeing we had just arrived in Rome and were feeling displaced anyway. However, once these issues were sorted, we found the staff friendly and willing to please. We stayed in the Garden Room which was lovely, however, no real place to sit comfortably besides the bed. There was a wrought iron bench seat and a wrought iron chaise lounge, but without cushioning, not very comfortable. The Garden Room had direct access onto the shared garden terrace which was lovely. I found the kitchen very basic and lacking in a range of utensils...I wasn't expecting every type of gadget, but basic things...eg. tongs, veg peeler, were missing and lots of improvising had to be done...I think this could be improved on. It was a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest metro, Lepanto, which we enjoyed, and a supermarket between the metro and the Villa where you could buy pretty much anything you need. If you want to stay somewhere "in the action', this is not the place, however a good place to stay away from the hustle and bustle of the city where you can relax and unwind. We found the room very clean and it was serviced every day. Relatively good value for money and would consider staying here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girldfriend and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Villa Laetitia and it was a great experience, quite a tribute since I wasn't in a good mood cos the cab driver from the airport conned me out of 50 euros!!!. The room was very unusual in its decor and made a nice change from standard hotel furniture. The girl on reception was called Eva and couldn't have been more helpful. It's a mere 15 min walk to central rome and less than 5 to Lepanto metro stop...
reviews.title: Superb Service and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top tips...get the bus/train/tube from the airport, we got 4 cabs during our stay, all drivers were rude, some dangerous and 1 was a conman. Eat at Trattoria de Gensola in Trastevere...best meal ever.
reviews.title: Lovely, quirky, 'boutique' hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked the Laetitia after looking at reviews for dozens of hotels in Rome. We were not disappointed. The location was fine.. a little out of the main centres, but (for us, keen walkers) only about 20 minutes from the Spanish Steps, the same to the Vatican and only 10 minutes from the nearest Metro (Lepanto, red line A ). The accomodation is in a modest villa set in the grounds of a larger villa, right on the main, riverside road (Lungatevere Delle Armi, west bank) a short distance from the nearest bridges. We picked the cheapest option, and got the Bambu room, just behind reception.. previous reviews had said this was a small, dark room... well, if you live in a 2 metere cave, yes, it would be! It was about 5 meters square, with a king-queen size bed (very comfy, memory-foam mattress and pillows), high ceilings with lovely mouldings and attractive, reclaimed wall and floor tiles throughout. There was a small kitchenette with full-size fridge (the only bit we used!), two ring hob, sink and a full range of crockery etc. The shower room was a good size, although the shower cabinet was tight for me (1.9m). Don't turn it on full either, as the funky, square shower rose squirts some water vertically up to the ceiling!
reviews.title: Love Love Love Villa Laetitia !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the sheets, towels etc were of high quality and changed every day! They even provide bathrobes and slippers! A flat screen tv/dvd and limited satelite service were also laid on. The gardens around the property are lovely and tranquil, idela for a late-night bottle or three of Chianti! (Only kidding! We only had one or two! )
reviews.title: A quiet enchanting villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Reception is open from 7-ish til 11pm (although often later) and you have keys and codes to access the premises outside these hours. The staff were friendly and helpful. Oh, and if it rains, there's a stack of monogrammed umbrellas available for guests to use at no charge.
reviews.title: Wonderful. I say again Wonderful!!!!!

likes.disliked: — It was a little far away from things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with a round bed. I don't know what it was called. It was at the end of the out-buildings. The kitchen and dining area was of decent size. A sitting area outside was also included. The bathroom was decent sized - handicapped accessible for the toilet, but I can't believe that it was for the shower. Big, round bed - nice! Free wifi. Water (still & sparkling) was included. The kitchen has a fridge.
reviews.title: Quiet & pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outside of the villa provides lots of seating. Several bicycles looked like they were available for guests - we didn't use them and didn't ask.
reviews.title: Villa Laetitia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was decent - it includes OJ, coffee/tea & pastries as well as quiche and other options.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although this is not a hotel in the center of things, it's not too far to walk to the Vatican or to the Pantheon (assuming that you like to walk!).
reviews.title: interesting hotel, slightly outside the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that the room did feel damp - our clothes & towels didn't feel quite dry. And, we left the back door open and let a couple mosquitoes in --- mistake! Once we got rid of the little guys, it was fine.
reviews.title: tiny showers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous. Didn't much look forward to crowded Rome in July, but Villa Laetitia made it a wonderful, laid back experience. The location, away from the maddening crowds, was perfect, and the staff in the hotel .... each and every one a pleasure to get to know. Breakfast was delicious, our Garden Room was perfect and our private terrace overlooking the gardens allowed us to relax outside, listening to birdsong rather than traffic. A word of warning, though: - if you are still craving traditional luxury Villa Laetitia may not be for you. However, if you have replaced your need for luxury with a deep appreciation of exclusivity ............ then this is your future address in Rome.
reviews.title: We found a home in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, very quiet as is set behind the main building. The room we had was great with a small kitchen with tea and coffee provided. All staff were wonderful, including the breakfast waiter who assisted in serving an unforgetable breakfast each morning. Best hotel I've stayed at.
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is even a computer area for printing etc as well as free wifi in the room.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel quiet a bit & can definitely say this is the nicest place I've ever stayed. The hotel itself is an old Roman building with the domed ceiling. The staff are the friendliest & most helpful people. We got caught in the rain one day & the cleaning lady insisted on washing & drying & ironing our clothes for us. She also gave us tea while we waiting in our fresh robes. You really cant put a price on service like that.
reviews.title: Our New Home in Rome...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is 3 street from the Metro stop which you can walk in 10 minutes. The room themselves a fully equipt with a kitchette & terraced area. I really cant think of anyway of improving our stay
reviews.title: Stylish with atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why stay in a hotel in the busy city centre when you can experience living in a leafy green suburb of Rome in such an amazing property - gardens, roof top terrace a beautiful 1900's mansion?
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at Villa Laetita for 8 nights in May in the Loden room and I could not have imagined a better place to have stayed. The property is beautiful and you feel relaxed as soon as you walk through the gates from a busy and sometimes hectic city. The surrounding suburb is lovely and the local restaraunts are far superior to anything you will find in the 'touristy' areas. Having a small kitchenette was fantastic and there is a supermarket 50 metres from your door. The staff were wonderful and very helpful, they made us feel very welcome. Our room was cleaned spotlessly each day.
reviews.title: Fabulous Villa Laetitia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The metro station is very close - a short stroll & a couple of minutes to all the sites by train. We never had a problem getting around by train or foot.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could not have imagined a better place to stay in Rome and look forward to visiting again.
reviews.title: Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at Villa Laetitia at the end of May when Rome was experiencing a bit of a heat wave!
reviews.title: Unique Accomodations in a Nice Neighborhood

likes.liked: — Price, style, comfort, quality, unique, away from hustle and bustle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we were unsure how to get inside the huge gates that protect the property; luckily, one of the staff was outside accepting a delivery, and he warmly ushered us inside. For the rest of your stay, you are given a password that operates the gates.
reviews.title: First impressions

likes.liked: — location and standard of decor/secluded location in busy city location
likes.disliked: — size of our room even tho we paid for standard accommodation

reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Stay
reviews.text: Hands down, the best thing about this place was the staff. Francesco and Federica were wonderful, friendly, and spoke English very, very well. Francesco was especially helpful in recommending restaurants (Cacio e Pepe just around the corner was a delightfully inexpensive place to have a meal the first night we arrived). He also pointed out a small cafe/bar that served freshly baked croissants in the mornings; it was also just around the corner and we might have overlooked it had we not known it was there! (Please note that Villa Laetitia, as it is more residence-style hotel, does not include breakfast in the morning as many hotels in Italy do. Therefore, those inexpensive and delicious croissants were welcome!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed with my dad and 11 year old niece for a few nights and days. The location is really nice. It is not a far walk to the centre and most of the sites of Rome. But the hotel is out just far enough that the nights are quiet and peaceful. We took a cab from the train station and it cost 20 euros. (BEWARE of a man that yells taxi and grabs your bags. He only wants to take your bags to the curb and then demands money)
reviews.title: Really Nice Idea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is just as pretty in person as it looks online.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - very very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a self service hotel and there is a grocery store nearby to get food. They will do a breakfast for you if you request and give them time to come to your room and set it up. The breakfast is nice but really expansive for what it is. The outside is really gorgeous and the setting is fabulous. We had an outdoor patio and the black and white room was big enough for the three of us.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was possibly the most uncomfortable bed I have slept in for a long time. The floor needed a good scrub! They do give you slippers and I was wearing them the moment I walked in the door because the floor was really dirty. They also give you a cozy robe.
reviews.title: Perfection.

likes.disliked: — Nothing really - Maybe that showering doesn't work in this room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were so friendly and helped us plan our trip into Rome. I did not ask them to clean the floor so maybe if I had it may have been a better stay. Overall it is a gorgeous hotel.. if they only mopped the floors!
reviews.title: Great hotel in Rome - Can't miss
